desc.yom_kippur: The holiest day in the Samaritan calendar, a day of fasting and atonement observed on the 10th of Tishrei
desc.unleavened_bread: Seven-day festival following Passover, celebrating the Exodus from Egypt with unleavened bread
desc.shemini_atzeret: The eighth day assembly following Sukkot, a solemn festival day
desc.shavuot: Celebrates the wheat harvest and commemorates the giving of the Torah at Mount Gerizim, observed 50 days after Passover
desc.passover: Commemorates the Exodus from Egypt, celebrated with the Passover sacrifice on Mount Gerizim
desc.rosh_hashanah: The Samaritan New Year, beginning on the first of Nisan in spring
desc.sukkot: Seven-day festival of booths or tabernacles, celebrating the harvest and remembering the wilderness journey

samaritan-festivals.footer_note: Samaritan calendar dates are approximate conversions to the Gregorian calendar. The Samaritan calendar follows a lunisolar system.

samaritan-festivals.info_pilgrimage: The three pilgrimage festivals (Passover, Shavuot, and Sukkot) are celebrated with pilgrimages to Mount Gerizim
samaritan-festivals.info_passover_sacrifice: The Passover sacrifice is performed annually on Mount Gerizim, continuing an ancient tradition
samaritan-festivals.info_gerizim: Mount Gerizim near Nablus is the holiest site in Samaritanism, where major festivals are celebrated
